title: New Swedish Co ID ::
content:
Hej!

Need some help with the keerning and spacing with this Logo. And advice if I need the AKTIEBOLAG, it could be shortened AB as well...

Its gonna be used as a mark/stamp.

I used a phonetic style because that is how one prenounce NICE in swedish. Any comments maybe on the colours as well.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081203110509im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/NAJSlogga_ny_4011.png)

 [‹ logotype](http://web.archive.org/web/20081203110509/http:/www.typophile.com/node/39421 "Go to previous forum topic") [Suitable font for a medical centre? ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081203110509/http:/www.typophile.com/node/39288 "Go to next forum topic")
author: KulanderMantilla

comments.content:
What does AKTIEBOLAG mean? Does it indicate the constitution of the company: something like Private Limited or Incorporated?

If yes, does it need to be part of the logo?
What is the purpose of the caron?

A freestanding caron isn’t part of any phonetic transcription system I’m aware of—what is it supposed to mean? Assuming you are using the International Phonetic Alphabet (since the other symbols are IPA symbols), if the caron is supposed to represent primary stress (my guess), you should use Unicode 02C8 (modifier letter vertical line: [ˈnajs]) instead. If the caron is supposed to represent rising intonation (as in, “Nice?”), it belongs over the ’a’: [nǎjs].

Otherwise I like the logo. I like the Aktiebolag, but it could be interesting to see an AB version too. And I like the colors; will the orange look very different in print than on screen?

Lycka till med logotypen!
